Description: The Flight into Egypt: a night piece; the Virgin seated on a donkey holding the Christ Child, while St Joseph leads the way towards the left while holding a lantern; first state with the figures of Joseph and the Virgin almost entirely white, with only diagonal hatchings in the upper right sky and and in the highlights caused by the lantern, before shading in Joseph's right hand and before additional shading in the lower part of the sky in the upper right. 1651 Etching, burin and drypoint, with surface tone
Curator's comments: This is first state, for impressions of later states and a counterproof see also F,4.104-109; and 1843,0607.33. For a late impression, re-worked by Basan, see 1941,0327.11.43. Three impressions (1843,0513.246; 1855,0414.261; and 1852,1211.44) are forgeries/ falsifications probably made by the Amsterdam art dealer Jean de Bary (see New Hollstein Introduction p. lix).
Bibliographic references: New Hollstein (Dutch & Flemish) / The New Hollstein: Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts 1450-1700 (262.I) (Rembrandt)
Hind 1923 / A Catalogue of Rembrandt's Etchings; chronologically arranged and completely illustrated (253.I)
White & Boon 1969 / Rembrandt's Etchings: An Illustrated Critical Catalogue (53.I)
Exhibition history: 2017-2018 21 Oct-7 Jan, Norwich Castle Museum and Art Gallery, Rembrandt: Lightening the Darkness 2019-2020 14 Nov-12 Jan, London, BM, G90a, '50th Anniversary of the Harold Wright Scholarship'
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Clayton Mordaunt Cracherode (L.607 with date 1798; Barnard sale, T. Philipe, 5.v.1798/part of lot 68 (£8 bt by John Thane, Cracherode's agent))
Acquisition notes: This impression was sold in one lot at Barnard's sale, together with F,4.104 described as 'two of the first impression, with difference in the effect'.
